sesemi.config package¶

Submodules¶

sesemi.config.resolvers module¶

Omegaconf resolvers.

class sesemi.config.resolvers.AttributeResolver¶

Bases: object

An omegaconf resolver that does attribute lookups on an object.

class sesemi.config.resolvers.SESEMIConfigAttributes¶

Bases: sesemi.config.resolvers.AttributeResolver

The attributes exposed to SESEMI configuration files.

These attributes can be referenced in the config files by following the omegaconf syntax for custom resolvers. For example, ${sesemi:iterations_per_epoch} will reference the iterations_per_epoch attribute.

iterations_per_epoch¶

The number of training iterations per epoch if training data is available.

Type

Optional[int]

max_iterations¶

The maximum number of training iterations if training data is available.

Type

Optional[int]

num_gpus¶

The number of GPUs that will be used.

Type

int

num_nodes¶

The number of compute nodes that will be used.

Type

int

iterations_per_epoch: Optional[int]¶
max_iterations: Optional[int]¶
num_gpus: int¶
num_nodes: int¶

sesemi.config.structs module¶

Omegaconf structured configurations.

class sesemi.config.structs.DataConfig(train: Optional[Dict[str, sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig]] = None, val: Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig] = None, test: Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig] = None)¶

Bases: object

The data group configuration.

train¶

An optional dictionary of data loader configurations. This configuration is directly mapped into dictionaries of data batches.

Type

Optional[Dict[str, sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig]]

val¶

An optional data loader configuration to use during validation.

Type

Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig]

test¶

An optional data loader configuration to use for testing.

Type

Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig]

test: Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig] = None¶
train: Optional[Dict[str, sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig]] = None¶
val: Optional[sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig] = None¶
class sesemi.config.structs.DataLoaderConfig(dataset: sesemi.config.structs.DatasetConfig, batch_size: Optional[int] = None, batch_size_per_gpu: Optional[int] = None, shuffle: bool = False, sampler: Optional[Any] = None, batch_sampler: Optional[Any] = None, num_workers: Optional[int] = 0, collate_fn: Optional[Any] = None, pin_memory: bool = False, drop_last: Optional[bool] = False, timeout: float = 0, worker_init_fn: Optional[Any] = None, _target_: str = 'sesemi.DataLoader')¶

Bases: object

The data loader configuration.

Most of the attributes are taken directly from PyTorch’s DataLoader object.

dataset¶

The dataset configuration.

Type

sesemi.config.structs.DatasetConfig

batch_size¶

An optional batch size to use for a PyTorch data loader. Cannot be set with batch_size_per_gpu.

Type

Optional[int]

batch_size_per_gpu¶

An optional batch size per GPU to use. Cannot be set with batch_size.

Type

Optional[int]

shuffle¶

Whether to shuffle the dataset at each epoch.

Type

bool

sampler¶

An optional sampler configuration.

Type

Optional[Any]

batch_sampler¶

An optional batch sampler configuration.

Type

Optional[Any]

num_workers¶

The number of workers to use for data loading (0 means use main process).

Type

Optional[int]

collate_fn¶

An optional collation callable configuration.

Type

Optional[Any]

pin_memory¶

Whether to pin tensors into CUDA.

Type

bool

drop_last¶

Whether to drop the last unevenly sized batch.

Type

Optional[bool]

timeout¶

The timeout to use get data batches from workers.

Type

float

worker_init_fn¶

An optional callable that is invoked for each worker on initialization.

Type

Optional[Any]

References

  • https://pytorch.org/docs/1.6.0/data.html?highlight=dataloader#torch.utils.data.DataLoader

batch_sampler: Optional[Any] = None¶
batch_size: Optional[int] = None¶
batch_size_per_gpu: Optional[int] = None¶
collate_fn: Optional[Any] = None¶
dataset: sesemi.config.structs.DatasetConfig¶
drop_last: Optional[bool] = False¶
num_workers: Optional[int] = 0¶
pin_memory: bool = False¶
sampler: Optional[Any] = None¶
shuffle: bool = False¶
timeout: float = 0¶
worker_init_fn: Optional[Any] = None¶
class sesemi.config.structs.DatasetConfig(name: str, root: Optional[str] = None, subset: Optional[Any] = None, image_transform: Optional[Any] = None, _target_: str = 'sesemi.dataset')¶

Bases: object

The SESEMI dataset configuration.

name¶

The name of the dataset in the registry.

Type

str

root¶

The absolute or relative (with respect to the run’s data root) path to the dataset. If this is None, then the run’s data_root attribute will be used instead.

Type

Optional[str]

subset¶

Can either be a the string name of the subset, a list of subsets, or None (null) to indicate the full set.

Type

Any

image_transform¶

An optional callable transform configuration that is applied to images.

Type

Any

image_transform: Any = None¶
name: str¶
root: Optional[str] = None¶
subset: Any = None¶
class sesemi.config.structs.LRSchedulerConfig(scheduler: Any, frequency: int = 1, interval: str = 'step', monitor: Optional[str] = None, strict: bool = True, name: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: object

A learning rate scheduler configuration.

scheduler¶

A learning rate scheduler that can be instantiated.

Type

Any

frequency¶

The frequency of learning rate updates as a multiple of interval.

Type

int

interval¶

Specifies the learning rate update interval. Can be either “step” or “epoch”.

Type

str

monitor¶

An optional metric that is monitored for specific kinds of schedulers.

Type

Optional[str]

strict¶

Wehether to enforce that the monitor metric should exist on updates.

Type

bool

name¶

An optional name that can be used by certain learning rate callbacks.

Type

Optional[str]

frequency: int = 1¶
interval: str = 'step'¶
monitor: Optional[str] = None¶
name: Optional[str] = None¶
scheduler: Any¶
strict: bool = True¶

class sesemi.config.structs.RunConfig(seed: Optional[int] = None, num_epochs: Optional[int] = None, num_iterations: Optional[int] = None, gpus: Any = - 1, num_nodes: int = 1, accelerator: Optional[str] = None, batch_size_per_gpu: Optional[int] = None, data_root: str = './data', id: str = 'default', dir: str = './runs', mode: sesemi.config.structs.RunMode = RunMode.FIT, resume_from_checkpoint: Optional[str] = None, pretrained_checkpoint_path: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: object

The run configuration.

seed¶

An optional random seed used on initialization.

Type

Optional[int]

num_epochs¶

The number of training epochs to train. Cannot be set with num_iterations.

Type

Optional[int]

num_iterations¶

The number of training iterations to run. Cannot be set with num_epochs.

Type

Optional[int]

gpus¶

Either an integer specifying the number of GPUs to use, a list of GPU integer IDs, a comma-separated list of GPU IDs, or None to train on the CPU. Setting this to -1 uses all GPUs and setting it to 0 also uses the CPU.

Type

Any

num_nodes¶

The number of nodes to use during training (defaults to 1).

Type

int

accelerator¶

Supports either “dp” or “ddp” (the default).

Type

Optional[str]

batch_size_per_gpu¶

An optional default batch size per GPU to use with all data loaders.

Type

Optional[int]

data_root¶

The directory to use as the parent of relative dataset root directories (see DatasetConfig).

Type

str

id¶

The identifier to use for the run.

Type

str

dir¶

The directory to store run outputs (e.g. logs, configurations, etc.).

Type

str

mode¶

The run’s mode.

Type

sesemi.config.structs.RunMode

resume_from_checkpoint¶

An optional checkpoint path to restore trainer state.

Type

Optional[str]

pretrained_checkpoint_path¶

An optional checkpoint path to load pretrained model weights.

Type

Optional[str]

accelerator: Optional[str] = None¶
batch_size_per_gpu: Optional[int] = None¶
data_root: str = './data'¶
dir: str = './runs'¶
gpus: Any = -1¶
id: str = 'default'¶
mode: sesemi.config.structs.RunMode = 'fit'¶
num_epochs: Optional[int] = None¶
num_iterations: Optional[int] = None¶
num_nodes: int = 1¶
pretrained_checkpoint_path: Optional[str] = None¶
resume_from_checkpoint: Optional[str] = None¶
seed: Optional[int] = None¶
class sesemi.config.structs.RunMode(value)¶

Bases: enum.Enum

The mode to use when running the training CLI.

FIT¶

Performs training and validation.

VALIDATE¶

Generates the validation metrics.

TEST¶

Generates the test metrics.

FIT = 'fit'¶
TEST = 'test'¶
VALIDATE = 'validate'¶
class sesemi.config.structs.SESEMIBaseConfig(run: sesemi.config.structs.RunConfig = RunConfig(seed=None, num_epochs=None, num_iterations=None, gpus=-1, num_nodes=1, accelerator=None, batch_size_per_gpu=None, data_root='./data', id='default', dir='./runs', mode=<RunMode.FIT: 'fit'>, resume_from_checkpoint=None, pretrained_checkpoint_path=None), data: sesemi.config.structs.DataConfig = DataConfig(train=None, val=None, test=None), learner: sesemi.config.structs.LearnerConfig = LearnerConfig(_target_='???'), trainer: Optional[Any] = None)¶
